abstract: In a 2010 interview with a local newspaper, Gary Foster, a midlevel Citigroup accountant who recently pleaded not guilty to embezzlement charges, crowed about one of his flashy properties, a high-end condominium in Jersey City.
snippet: In a 2010 interview with a local newspaper, Gary Foster, a midlevel Citigroup accountant who recently pleaded not guilty to embezzlement charges, crowed about one of his flashy properties, a high-end condominium in Jersey City.
lead_paragraph: Gary Foster may have been a midlevel accountant in Citigroup’s office in Long Island City, Queens, earning $100,000 a year. But his real estate holdings were more fitting for a high-flying mogul.
